meanings.definition: Save (someone) from a dangerous or distressing situation.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter rescued the kitten from the burning building.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard rescued the swimmer from drowning in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The superhero rescued the cat stuck in a tree, much to the amusement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words rescued him from the depths of despair.
meanings.sent5: The brave knight rescued the princess from the evil dragon, becoming a hero in the kingdom.

meanings.definition: Retrieve or preserve (something) from potential loss or harm.
meanings.sent1: She rescued her favorite book from the shelf before the storm hit.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist rescued the ancient artifact from being destroyed by looters.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel rescued the acorn from rolling down the hill, showing its determination.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking rescued the situation from turning into a disaster.
meanings.sent5: The timely intervention rescued the fragile vase from falling and breaking into pieces.
